title: Conflict and Argument Idioms
content: Complete the idioms and phrases related to conflict and arguments by filling in the missing words.

questions.instructions: Complete the idioms by filling in the missing words. Type your answers in the fields provided.
questions.question: Complete the following idioms and phrases:
field_labels: 1. A [field 1] of wills - A disagreement where both sides are determined to win
2. Get off (someone's) [field 2] - Stop criticising or telling someone what to do
3. Bury the [field 3] - To stop and argument and agree to make peace
4. Send (someone) [field 4] - To tell someone to leave
5. Wipe the [field 5] clean (very similar to 'bury the hatchet') - To forget about previous disagreements or problems and to start again
6. [field 6] on thin ice - Doing or saying something that could easily/quickly end up in a disagreement or trouble
7. Pick [field 7] in (something) - Trying to finding faults in something someone is doing or saying
8. An [field 8] branch - Something you do, say or offer to try an end a disagreement
9. Add [field 9] to the fire - To make a situation or argument even worse
10. At each other's [field 10] - Always arguing (normally strongly)
11. A [field 11] point - A subject that someone is sensitive about and should therefore be avoided
12. A [field 12] battle - A disagreement that has been going on for some time
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is shown above. Study these idioms to improve your understanding of conflict-related expressions.
